tfa.title: Marshfield_station
tfa.extract: Marshfield was a rapid transit station on the Chicago "L" in service between 1895 and 1954. Constructed by the Metropolitan West Side Elevated Railroad, it was the westernmost station of the Metropolitan's main line, which then diverged into three branches. Marshfield was also served by the Chicago Aurora and Elgin Railroad (CA&E), an interurban, between 1905 and 1953.
tfa.extract_html: Marshfield was a rapid transit station on the Chicago "L" in service between 1895 and 1954. artist.html: Ralf Roletschek

captions.ar: ( سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي أَسْرَىٰ بِعَبْدِهِ لَيْلًا مِّنَ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ إِلَى الْمَسْجِدِ الْأَقْصَى الَّذِي بَارَكْنَا حَوْلَهُ لِنُرِيَهُ مِنْ آيَاتِنَا ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْبَصِيرُ ) سورة الإسراء الآية (1)

links.title: 2024_Hualien_earthquake
links.extract: On 3 April 2024, at 07:58:11 NST, a Mw 7.4 earthquake struck 18 km (11 mi) south-southwest of Hualien City, Hualien County, Taiwan. At least 10 people died and over 1,000 were injured in the earthquake. It is the largest earthquake in Taiwan since the 1999 Jiji earthquake, with several aftershocks above Mw 5.0 occurring.
links.extract_html: On 3 April 2024, at 07:58:11 NST, a Mw 7.4 earthquake struck 18 km (11 mi) south-southwest of Hualien City, Hualien County, Taiwan. At least 10 people died and over 1,000 were injured in the earthquake. It is the largest earthquake in Taiwan since the 1999 Jiji earthquake, with several aftershocks above Mw 5.0 occurring.

links.title: Hualien_City
links.description: County-administered city in Taiwan Province, Taiwan
links.extract: Hualien City is a county-administered city and the county seat of Hualien County, Taiwan. It is located on the east coast of Taiwan on the Pacific Ocean, and has a population of 99,458 inhabitants.
links.extract_html: Hualien City is a county-administered city and the county seat of Hualien County, Taiwan. It is located on the east coast of Taiwan on the Pacific Ocean, and has a population of 99,458 inhabitants.

news.story: An earthquake strikes near Hualien City, Taiwan (damage pictured).

links.title: 2024_Mmamatlakala_bus_crash
links.description: 2024 bus accident in Limpopo, South Africa
links.extract: On 28 March 2024, a passenger bus crashed near Mamatlakala in Limpopo, the northernmost province of South Africa, killing 45 people and leaving an eight-year-old girl, who sustained serious injuries, as the sole survivor. According to the South African Department of Transport, the incident occurred when the driver lost control. The bus went over a bridge and then caught on fire. The bus was transporting Easter pilgrims from Gaborone, Botswana, to Moria, South Africa.
links.extract_html: On 28 March 2024, a passenger bus crashed near Mamatlakala in Limpopo, the northernmost province of South Africa, killing 45 people and leaving an eight-year-old girl, who sustained serious injuries, as the sole survivor. According to the South African Department of Transport, the incident occurred when the driver lost control. The bus went over a bridge and then caught on fire. The bus was transporting Easter pilgrims from Gaborone, Botswana, to Moria, South Africa.

links.title: Limpopo
links.extract: Limpopo is the northernmost province of South Africa. It is named after the Limpopo River, which forms the province's western and northern borders. The capital and largest city in the province is Polokwane, while the provincial legislature is situated in Lebowakgomo.
links.extract_html: Limpopo is the northernmost province of South Africa. It is named after the Limpopo River, which forms the province's western and northern borders. The capital and largest city in the province is Polokwane, while the provincial legislature is situated in Lebowakgomo.

news.story: A bus falls from a bridge in Limpopo, South Africa, killing 45 people.

links.title: Francis_Scott_Key_Bridge_collapse
links.description: 2024 bridge collapse near Baltimore, Maryland, United States
links.extract: On March 26, 2024, at 1:28 a.m. EDT, the main spans and the three nearest northeast approach spans of the Francis Scott Key Bridge across the Patapsco River in the Baltimore metropolitan area of Maryland collapsed after the container ship Dali struck one of its piers. Two people were rescued from the river; one had no injuries, while the other was transported to a hospital in critical condition. Six members of a maintenance crew working on the roadway were reported missing; two bodies were recovered, and the other four are presumed dead.
links.extract_html: On March 26, 2024, at 1:28 a.m. EDT, the main spans and the three nearest northeast approach spans of the Francis Scott Key Bridge across the Patapsco River in the Baltimore metropolitan area of Maryland collapsed after the container ship Dali struck one of its piers. Two people were rescued from the river; one had no injuries, while the other was transported to a hospital in critical condition. Six members of a maintenance crew working on the roadway were reported missing; two bodies were recovered, and the other four are presumed dead.

links.title: Francis_Scott_Key_Bridge_(Baltimore)
links.extract: The Francis Scott Key Bridge was a steel arch continuous through truss bridge that spanned the lower Patapsco River and outer Baltimore Harbor / Port. It carried the Baltimore Beltway between Hawkins Point, an isolated southern neighborhood of Baltimore, and Dundalk in Maryland, United States. The crossing between Baltimore City and Baltimore County also passed through a small portion of Anne Arundel County. The main spans and part of the north-eastern approach of the bridge collapsed on March 26, 2024, after the container ship MV Dali struck one of its piers.
links.extract_html: The Francis Scott Key Bridge was a steel arch continuous through truss bridge that spanned the lower Patapsco River and outer Baltimore Harbor / Port. It carried the Baltimore Beltway between Hawkins Point, an isolated southern neighborhood of Baltimore, and Dundalk in Maryland, United States. The crossing between Baltimore City and Baltimore County also passed through a small portion of Anne Arundel County. The main spans and part of the north-eastern approach of the bridge collapsed on March 26, 2024, after the container ship MV Dali struck one of its piers.

links.title: Baltimore
links.extract: Baltimore is the most populous city in the U.S. state of Maryland. With a population of 585,708 at the 2020 census, it is the 30th-most populous city in the United States. Baltimore was designated an independent city by the Constitution of Maryland in 1851, and is currently the most populous independent city in the nation. As of the 2020 census, the population of the Baltimore metropolitan area was estimated to be 2,838,327, making it the 20th-largest metropolitan area in the country. When combined with the larger Washington metropolitan area, the Washington–Baltimore combined statistical area (CSA) has a 2020 U.S. census population of 9,973,383, the third-largest in the country.
links.extract_html: Baltimore is the most populous city in the U.S. state of Maryland. With a population of 585,708 at the 2020 census, it is the 30th-most populous city in the United States. Baltimore was designated an independent city by the Constitution of Maryland in 1851, and is currently the most populous independent city in the nation. As of the 2020 census, the population of the Baltimore metropolitan area was estimated to be 2,838,327, making it the 20th-largest metropolitan area in the country. When combined with the larger Washington metropolitan area, the Washington–Baltimore combined statistical area (CSA) has a 2020 U.S. census population of 9,973,383, the third-largest in the country.

links.title: MV_Dali
links.extract: MV Dali is a 2015-built Neopanamax container ship chartered to Maersk. On 26 March 2024, she collided with the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, Maryland, United States, causing a catastrophic structural failure of the bridge.
links.extract_html: MV Dali is a 2015-built Neopanamax container ship chartered to Maersk. On 26 March 2024, she collided with the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, Maryland, United States, causing a catastrophic structural failure of the bridge.

news.story: The Francis Scott Key Bridge in the U.S. city of Baltimore collapses after being hit by a container ship.

links.title: 2024_Senegalese_presidential_election
links.extract: Presidential elections were held in Senegal on 24 March 2024. Incumbent president Macky Sall was ineligible to pursue a third term due to term limits in the Constitution of Senegal.
links.extract_html: Presidential elections were held in Senegal on 24 March 2024. Incumbent president Macky Sall was ineligible to pursue a third term due to term limits in the Constitution of Senegal.

links.title: Bassirou_Diomaye_Faye
links.extract: Bassirou Diomaye Diakhar Faye, commonly known mononymously as Diomaye, is a Senegalese politician and former tax inspector who has served as the 5th and current President of Senegal since 2024. He is the general secretary of the banned party PASTEF and won the 2024 Senegalese presidential election in place of disqualified candidate Ousmane Sonko, whom he later appointed as Prime Minister.
links.extract_html: Bassirou Diomaye Diakhar Faye, commonly known mononymously as Diomaye, is a Senegalese politician and former tax inspector who has served as the 5th and current President of Senegal since 2024. He is the general secretary of the banned party PASTEF and won the 2024 Senegalese presidential election in place of disqualified candidate Ousmane Sonko, whom he later appointed as Prime Minister.

links.title: President_of_Senegal
links.description: Head of state and government of Senegal
links.extract: The president of Senegal is the head of state and head of government of Senegal. In accordance with the constitutional reform of 2001 and since a referendum that took place on 20 March 2016, the president is elected for a 5-year term, with a limit of two consecutive terms. The following is a list of presidents of Senegal, since the country gained independence from France in 1960.
links.extract_html: The president of Senegal is the head of state and head of government of Senegal. In accordance with the constitutional reform of 2001 and since a referendum that took place on 20 March 2016, the president is elected for a 5-year term, with a limit of two consecutive terms. The following is a list of presidents of Senegal, since the country gained independence from France in 1960.

news.story: Bassirou Diomaye Faye is elected President of Senegal.

links.title: Crocus_City_Hall_attack
links.description: 2024 mass shooting and explosion in Krasnogorsk, Russia
links.extract: On 22 March 2024, a terrorist attack carried out by the Islamic State occurred at the Crocus City Hall music venue in Krasnogorsk, Moscow Oblast, Russia.
links.extract_html: On 22 March 2024, a terrorist attack carried out by the Islamic State occurred at the Crocus City Hall music venue in Krasnogorsk, Moscow Oblast, Russia.

links.title: Crocus_City_Hall
links.description: Concert venue in Moscow Oblast, Russia
links.extract: The Crocus City Hall is a music venue located in Krasnogorsk, Moscow Oblast. The venue was opened by the businessman Aras Agalarov on 25 October 2009. On 22 March 2024, it was severely damaged by an explosion during a major terrorist attack that killed at least 144 people.
links.extract_html: The Crocus City Hall is a music venue located in Krasnogorsk, Moscow Oblast. The venue was opened by the businessman Aras Agalarov on 25 October 2009. On 22 March 2024, it was severely damaged by an explosion during a major terrorist attack that killed at least 144 people.

links.title: Krasnogorsk,_Moscow_Oblast
links.extract: Krasnogorsk is a city and the administrative center of Krasnogorsky District in Moscow Oblast, Russia, located on the Moskva River, adjacent to the northwestern boundary of Moscow. It has a population of 187,634 (2021 Census);
links.extract_html: Krasnogorsk is a city and the administrative center of Krasnogorsky District in Moscow Oblast, Russia, located on the Moskva River, adjacent to the northwestern boundary of Moscow. It has a population of 187,634 (2021 Census);

news.story: A mass shoot­ing and ex­plo­sions kill 144 people at the Crocus City Hall in Krasnogorsk, Russia.
